definitions.definition: to cook food in an oven without extra fat or liquid; to be cooked in this way
definitions.sensetop: bake (something)bake something for somebodybake somebody something
definitions.labels: (British English)(North American English)(British English)(North American English)(especially North American English)(British English)(British English)

examples.text: the delicious smell of baking bread
The bread is baking in the oven.
I'm baking a birthday cake for Alex.

definitions.definition: to become hard when heated; to make something hard by heating it

examples.text: The bricks are left in the kiln to bake.
The sun had baked the ground hard.

definitions.definition: to be or become very hot

examples.text: We sat baking in the sun.

wordOrigin: Old English bacan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bakken and German backen.
